a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Comparison of median income (or consumption) in LIS and World Bank
This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Median income or expenditure per day (PIP)
Daily median equivalized disposable household income
Note: PIP data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it
relates to either disposable income or consumption per capita. LIS data in addition adjusts for the
Data source: Incomes across the Distribution Database (Nolan, Thewissen, Roser) in levels (2016); World Bank PIP
